7.24.21  10:37 pm   is there a reason that "memory" appears between aaaacv and frenca, then again between frenez and loveqa and yeat again between lovesz and zzzzya in the part of got some money where the 6-letter combinations are scrolling down the screen? 

      yes. What i would have preferred to do, is to be able to actually create that entire alphabetical phrase list. which i was able to generate quite easily, but the problem we run into, when the list goes into the graphics, .... the list is so long that it actually makes the computer lag, or probably even crash, depending on how you do it. There's literally millions of lines in that text pattern, if it were carried out properly from a to z across all 6 characters. So even though it's just text, it actually is an absurdly unnecessary strain on the memory of the scene, pretty much any way you slice it. And the truth is, in that scene, with the small amount of time it's shown, you'd never see all the lines. and also, another reason you don't wanna include the whole list is that the scroll direction would become incoherently out of phase. like those car wheels on tv that seem to move slow or backwards or whatever. So it turns out, even just to create the proper looking downward scroll, you need to reduce the number of elements drastically. like pretty much skip 99% of the parts during the fast scroll. But this still does create a continuity problem, because if anyone sees the (maybe 1) frame where you can see it jump from A to L or whatever, .... i feel there's gonna need to be an explanation there. So my explanation is 'memory' as a place holder for the perhaps millions of lines we've skipped

How did orchestrating that tiny bit make you feel?

7.23.21  9:11 pm   why in new canaan the line

"i'm gonna go to starbucks, and play my ukelele
under the bright blue sky
i'm goin to new canaan and everything feels just right"

HITS SO FUCKING HARD HOLY SHIT BILL YOUR AMAZING

      the reason for this is because i gave it a re-write, 3 years later. the original line, written on 5/15/2009 actually on location in new canaan, was 'sittin outside starbucks in the hot warm sun, eating my spaghettios', to the exact same melody as the 'let me stop in harlem' line from the previous verse. but, thanks to the rewrite, years later with more songwriting experience and actually next to a keyboard instrument, i was able to sum up the same scenario with a little more perspective, and nostalgia. including the ukulele which i actually didn't buy until the following week, 5/23/2009, but was thinking about getting

7.23.21  8:36 pm   how did you manage to get exponentially better at music production and at video making at the same time?!

      that's easy. just take infinite time on it

7.23.21  5:36 pm   It seems with the "got some money" video you've explored the charms, power, and convenience of a more minimalist visual style. Have you thought about taking a similar approach to recording your songs?

      yes. that's probably my only hope at this point

7.23.21  4:24 pm   whenever i am brainstorming, it's like there are so many ideas coming into my head it's like ahhh im gonna miss some of these, even when I'm writing as fast as i can. what is something i can do about this

      2 strategies:
     1. write more, so you get better at writing, from the practice.
     2. write less, so you'll learn how to make the writing better, to compensate for the scarcity

7.23.21  3:42 pm   what is your favorite type of water?

7.23.21  2:22 pm   A bit after the release of I'm A Princess, I realized the grammatical meaning of the 3rd verse (the one with the soldiers), and that, grammatically, "dreamed that it's ok" would refer to the soldiers doing the dreaming. I felt a bit disappointed when I realized this because to me it feels very strangely powerful to think of that line as disconnected from the previous lines in a songy sort of way, only being connected to the daydream line by a shared word, and perhaps referring to the narrator doing the dreaming. This interpretation also turns the previous lines from a sentence to just some relevant imagery, which also feels more powerful to me. Do you internalize that verse as one big sentence or as a series of disconnected lines? What did you intend?

      i probably intended to find something better, but, i couldn't really figure out how to work the grammar to add up correctly and still get the sound i wanted. by the way, it's "i dreamed that it's ok" although the "i" is probably not vocalized. You can put the phrase boundaries in two different places. the soldiers "make sure i'm lonely through the daydream", ... or ... "through the daydream, i dreamed that it's ok". Hopefully by the end you've gotten a bit of both
